content:
ProfileSettingsCollection Class

In this Article

Contains a collection of ProfileSettings objects. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Configuration.ConfigurationCollection(typeof(System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings))]
public sealed class ProfileSettingsCollection : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ConfigurationElement
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection
  • ProfileSettingsCollection

Remarks

ProfileSettings objects are used to define event profiles.

Constructors summary

ProfileSettingsCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the ProfileSettingsCollection class.

Properties summary

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the ProfileSettings object at the specified numeric index in the collection.
Item(String)

Gets the ProfileSettings object based on the specified key in the collection.
Properties

Methods summary

Add(ProfileSettings)

Adds a ProfileSettings object to the collection.
Clear()

Removes all ProfileSettings objects from the collection.
Contains(String)

Indicates whether the collection contains a ProfileSettings object with the specified name.
CreateNewElement()
GetElementKey(ConfigurationElement)
IndexOf(String)

Returns the index of the specified ProfileSettings object.
Insert(Int32,ProfileSettings)

Inserts the specified ProfileSettings object at the specified index in the collection.
Remove(String)

Removes a BufferModeSettings object from the collection.
RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes a ProfileSettings object at the specified index location from the collection.

Constructors

  • ProfileSettingsCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the ProfileSettingsCollection class.

    public ProfileSettingsCollection ();

    Remarks

    The Profiles property of the HealthMonitoringSection class always contains an instance of the ProfileSettingsCollection. Use this instance, rather than creating your own.

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the ProfileSettings object at the specified numeric index in the collection.

    public System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of a ProfileSettings object in the collection.

    Property Value

    • ProfileSettings

      The ProfileSettings object at the specified index, or null if there is no object at that index.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Item method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    profileSetting = healthMonitoringSection.Profiles[i];

    profileSetting = healthMonitoringSection.Profiles(i)
  • Item(String)

    Gets the ProfileSettings object based on the specified key in the collection.

    public System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings this[string key] { get; }

    Parameters

    • key
      String

      The name of the ProfileSettings object contained in the collection.

    Property Value

    • ProfileSettings

      A ProfileSettings object.

  • Properties
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ConfigurationPropertyCollection

      To be added.

Methods

  • Add(ProfileSettings)

    Adds a ProfileSettings object to the collection.

    public void Add (System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings profilesSettings);

    Parameters

    • profilesSettings
      ProfileSettings

      A ProfileSettings object to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      The ProfileSettings object to add already exists in the collection, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    The collection must not already contain a ProfileSettings object with the same name.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Add method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    
// Get the current Enabled property value.
Boolean enabledValue = healthMonitoringSection.Enabled;

// Set the Enabled property to false.
healthMonitoringSection.Enabled = false;

    
' Get the current Enabled property value.
Dim enabledValue As Boolean = healthMonitoringSection.Enabled

' Set the Enabled property to False.
healthMonitoringSection.Enabled = False
  • Clear()

    Removes all ProfileSettings objects from the collection.

    public void Clear ();

    Remarks

    This method inserts a clear directive into the appropriate section of the configuration file to clear all references to elements defined in a higher-level configuration file. All elements defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file are removed.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Clear method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    // Clear all ProfileSettings object from the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Clear();

    ' Clear all ProfileSettings object from the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Clear()
  • Contains(String)

    Indicates whether the collection contains a ProfileSettings object with the specified name.

    public bool Contains (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of a ProfileSettings object in the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the collection contains a ProfileSettings object with the specified name; otherwise, false.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Contains method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    // See if the ProfileSettings collection property contains the event 'Default'.
Console.WriteLine("Profiles contains 'Default': {0}.",
    healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Contains("Default"));

    ' See if the ProfileSettings collection property contains the event 'Default'.
Console.WriteLine("Profiles contains 'Default': {0}.", _
    healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Contains("Default"))
  • CreateNewElement()
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement CreateNewElement ();

    Returns

    • ConfigurationElement

      To be added.

  • GetElementKey(ConfigurationElement)
    protected override object GetElementKey (System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement element);

    Parameters

    • element
      ConfigurationElement

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Object

      To be added.

  • IndexOf(String)

    Returns the index of the specified ProfileSettings object.

    public int IndexOf (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of a ProfileSettings object in the collection.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the specified ProfileSettings object, or -1 if the object is not found in the collection.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the IndexOf method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    // Get the index of the 'Default' ProfileSettings in the Profiles collection property.
Console.WriteLine("Profiles index for 'Default': {0}.",
    healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.IndexOf("Default"));

    ' Get the index of the 'Default' ProfileSettings in the Profiles collection property.
Console.WriteLine("Profiles index for 'Default': {0}.", _
    healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.IndexOf("Default"))
  • Insert(Int32,ProfileSettings)

    Inserts the specified ProfileSettings object at the specified index in the collection.

    public void Insert (int index, System.Web.Configuration.ProfileSettings authorizationSettings);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of a ProfileSettings object in the collection.

    • authorizationSettings
      ProfileSettings

      A ProfileSettings object to insert into the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      The ProfileSettings object to add already exists in the collection, the index is invalid, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    If the index parameter equals the number of items in the collection, then the entry is appended to the end of the collection.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Insert method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    // Insert an ProfileSettings object into the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Insert(1, new ProfileSettings("Default2"));

    ' Insert an ProfileSettings object into the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Insert(1, new ProfileSettings("Default2"))
  • Remove(String)

    Removes a BufferModeSettings object from the collection.

    public void Remove (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of a ProfileSettings object to remove from the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      There is no ProfileSettings object with the specified key in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    This method inserts a remove element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the Remove method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    // Remove a ProfileSettings object from the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Remove("Default");

    ' Remove a ProfileSettings object from the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.Remove("Default")
  • RemoveAt(Int32)

    Removes a ProfileSettings object at the specified index location from the collection.

    public void RemoveAt (int index);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of a ProfileSettings object in the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ConfigurationException

      There is no ProfileSettings object at the specified index in the collection, the element has already been removed, or the collection is read-only.

    Remarks

    This method inserts a remove element into the appropriate section of the configuration file for any element defined in a higher-level configuration file. If the element is defined in the appropriate section of the current configuration file, its entry is removed from the configuration file. The object to remove must exist in the collection.

    Example

    The following code example shows how to use the RemoveAt method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the HealthMonitoringSection class. 

    // Remove a ProfileSettings object from the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.RemoveAt(0);

    ' Remove a ProfileSettings object from the Profiles collection property.
healthMonitoringSection.Profiles.RemoveAt(0)
